parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>False. There is no CMF number present in the provided post information.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>False. The post does not refer to any specific parliamentary candidate by name, surname, or party affiliation.  It mentions Adrian Măniuțiu, but this is not presented in an electoral context.</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>True. The post is a paid advertisement on Facebook, a public platform, and its content ("Cine e foarte drăguț și are nevoie de mulți bani? Desigur, bebelușul familiei.") is designed to appeal to a broad audience of parents or those planning to have children.  The reach estimate is ">1M", further supporting this.</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>False. The objective of the post is not to influence the vote in the parliamentary elections. The content focuses on family budgeting advice related to having a baby, a topic unrelated to the election.</electoral-objective>
<journalism>True. The post can be considered a form of promotional journalism or citizen journalism, aiming to promote the services or expertise of Adrian Măniuțiu in the context of family finance. It is not directly influencing the vote in any election.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>Not applicable. The post doesn't express a personal opinion related to the election.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>28561627833436017</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The Facebook post, while a paid advertisement, does not constitute electoral propaganda under Article 98 t) of LEGE nr. 208 din 20 iulie 2015.  The content is focused on family budgeting advice, a topic unrelated to the parliamentary elections.  There is no mention of any candidate or party, nor any attempt to influence voters' choices. The advertisement targets a broad audience and does not meet the criteria outlined in Article 36 (7) of LEGE nr. 334 din 17 iulie 2006 for electoral propaganda.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>FALSE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates/>
<responsible-party-or-group>EM360</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police/>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
